snippet: On Twitter, the posts of imitators like ElBloombito and FakeJohnSampson raise a funhouse mirror to the feats and foibles of city and state officials in New York.
abstract: Alter egos of several New York political figures maintain presences on Twitter, to the amusement, or chagrin, of their inspirations. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: WE know that Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg dabbles in broken Spanish. We suspect that Sheldon Silver, the State Assembly speaker, doles out the occasional Yiddish barb. And we allow for the possibility that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo might, in fact, have felt ''FABULOUS'' after the passage of same-sex marriage legislation last year. On Twitter, thankfully, there needn't be any doubt. While officials in City Hall and Albany use the medium to communicate judiciously -- eager to please, careful not to offend -- a band of imitators has formed a shadow Twitter government all its own, raising a funhouse mirror to the feats and foibles of New York's political class.
